title: Boy who cant speak forms unbreakable bond with deaf dog through sign language
text:
Connor and Ellie are best friends Picture: Facebook/Brandi Guillet) Sometimes in life, if you’re lucky enough, you’ll find your soulmate.
And for one little boy, that is exactly what happened.
Missing man found dead in canal weeks after ‘brutal baseball bat attack’ Connor Guillet, who cannot speak, met Ellie the deaf boxer for the first time this Christmas when she was fostered by his family.
And straight away, the pair formed an unbreakable bond – by using sign language.
The now six-year-old from Florida, who was adopted by mum, Brandi Guillet, at birth, was born with a genetic disorder.

Uploading a picture of the pair together onto Facebook, Brandi said: ‘I adopted my son at birth knowing he had a genetic disorder. He is now six and non verbal, but uses sign for communication.
‘We are fostering a beautiful deaf boxer girl and she is amazing with my son. She is the most gentle, loving girl ever.
People who go to A&E with toothaches are ‘costing NHS up to £18m a year’ ‘The most beautiful part of this adoption is my son and his dog can actually talk to each other!
‘ There is something so special about this dog. Something different… I’m so drawn to her.’ 
‘I highly encourage adoption of deaf dogs… She is such a perfect addition to our family. We have been blessed with Ellie.’
The family now plan on adopting Ellie so she can become a permanent member of their family.
